    >           Academics          >           Undergraduate          >           Practicum                            Practicum        Through the practicum, students gain hands-on experince in a particular industry or professional field. The focus of the practicum courses are currently on the fashion industry. The fall practicum will be taught by a prominent member of the fashion industry, who holds the Guess Distinguished Visiting Chair in Fashion Business. Recording Practicum III                     Time: 60 hours Credits: 4 credits Term: Fall Instructor: Alexandra Von Oertzen    Pre-requisites: MPATE-UE 1003 . Principles covered in Recording Technology I & II are put into practice with additional theory and hands-on training. Students perform various duties just as they would in a professional recording session. Nursing Education Practicum III: Curriculum Evaluation | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                          Undergraduate   Graduate   Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                                     Academics                   Home > Academics                                                                       < Back  Nursing Education Practicum III: Curriculum Evaluation                      NURSE-GN 2175, 3 Credits, (Spring)  In this final practicum course, students conduct all aspects of the nurse-educator role for academic and/or health care agency settings. The emphasis is on evaluating nursing curriculum based on the criteria of national educational and health care agency accreditation, standards of professional nursing educational organizations, and the expected legal registered nurse practice competencies that meet the health care needs of society, especially those of vulnerable and medically underserved populations.
